alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 10:58PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of eastern Essex, Lamoille, Caledonia, Orange, Orleans, Essex, Addison, southern Chittenden, northeastern Windsor, Washington and eastern Franklin Counties through 1130 PM EST... At 1058 PM EST, A snow squall was reported along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Rangeley to Chelsea. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds 35 mph or greater, and visibility less than a mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and will blow around unsecured objects. Low visibility may pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Barre, St. Johnsbury, Montpelier, Middlebury, Newport City, Vergennes, Island Pond, Lyndon, Moriah, Morrisville, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Newport Town, Glover, Waterbury Village, Websterville and Albany. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 24 and 80. Interstate 91 between mile markers 81 and 91, between mile markers 94 and 121, and between mile markers 123 and 177. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11.
